column2: Cure any illness or symptom from §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!.
Remove an affliction of the mind from §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!.
Heal a wound or disfigurement from from §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!.
Remove a defect or aberration trait from §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!.
Extend the life of §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! by two years.
Inflict an aberration or deformity upon §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!.
Restore the various doctrines of the Germanic faith, according to the chosen laws of the realm.
Doctrine is restored according to set laws.
A religious doctrine of the faith has been changed, giving a minor decrease to moral authority.
The Fylkir gathers vassal priests to create a grand book, which contains all scripture and knowledge within the Germanic religion.
Under certain conditions, the Fylkir may vassalize the Varangian Guard.
Found the Jarnhendur, the Fylkir's personal bodyguard and army.
Controls whether the Fylkir has the power to grant divorces between members of the Germanic faith or excommunicate members from the faith.
The Fylkir may neither grant divorces, nor excommunicate members of the Germanic faith.
The Fylkir may now grant divorces to members the Germanic faith.
The Fylkir may now excommunicate members from the Germanic faith.
Controls whether the Fylkir has the power to grant claims and money to members of the Germanic faith.
Grant Claims Disallowed and Money Requests Disallowed
The Fylkir may not grant claims on titles to members of the Germanic faith, nor may they request money of the Fylkir.
Members of the Germanic faith may request money from the Fylkir.
The Fylkir may grant claims on titles to members of the Germanic faith.

Controls whether the Fylkir has the power to grant the invasion Casus Belli to members of the Germanic faith and whether members of the faith are likely to come to the Fylkir's aid in defensive religious wars.
Grant Invasion Disallowed and No Religious Head Defense
The Fylkir may not sanction invasions, and members of the faith are not likely to come to the Fylkir's aid in defensive religious wars.
The Fylkir may sanction invasions to members of the Germanic faith.
Members of the Germanic faith are likely to come to the Fylkir's aid in defensive religious wars.
Controls access to what criminal punishments are available to members of the Germanic faith.
Adherents of the Germanic faith may neither blind prisoners, nor castrate them.
Adherents of the Germanic faith may blind prisoners as a form of punishment.
Adherents of the Germanic faith may castrate prisoners as a form of punishment.
Two year cooldown to ask for money.
One year cooldown to pass trait.
I've changed my mind. The member doctrines are fine as is.
I've changed my mind. The war doctrines are fine as is.
Great §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!, I am in need of gold in my struggles to manage the realm. Perhaps in your wisdom, you might see fit to aid me?
Your request for gold is granted.
I am unable to fulfill your request for gold.
Request for gold is not granted.

As the leader of the many Germanic faithful, it has become apparent that the Fylkirate requires a force to protect itself from enemies both within and without the realm. Wavering neither in the sight of the heathen, nor in the face of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] or any other evil, the Jarnhendur will be the iron hand of the [Root.GetTitle], carrying out [Root.GetHerHis] and [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s will until the end of time.
They shall serve me with honor.
